Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruits that enlarge and turn dark brown.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Use disease-free seed, avoid overhead irrigation, apply copper-based bactericides.

Pepper__bell___healthy.symptoms: Uniform green leaves without any lesions or discoloration.
Pepper__bell___healthy.treatment: Maintain good field sanitation and balanced nutrition.

Potato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark concentric rings on older leaves, yellowing, and leaf drop.
Potato___Early_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb; rotate crops annually.

Potato___healthy.symptoms: Healthy green leaves without any lesions or wilting.
Potato___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper irrigation and avoid overcrowding.

Potato___Late_blight.symptoms: Dark brown to black lesions with pale green edges; rapid spread under humid conditions.
Potato___Late_blight.treatment: Remove infected plants, use resistant varieties, and spray copper fungicides.

Tomato_Target_Spot.symptoms: Circular brown spots with light centers on leaves; may cause leaf drop.
Tomato_Target_Spot.treatment: Apply preventive fungicides such as azoxystrobin or chlorothalonil.

Tomato_Tomato_mosaic_virus.symptoms: Mottled light and dark green patches on leaves, leaf distortion, and stunted growth.
Tomato_Tomato_mosaic_virus.treatment: Remove infected plants; disinfect tools; use resistant varieties.

Tomato_Tomato_YellowLeaf_Curl_Virus.symptoms: Upward curling and yellowing of young leaves, stunted plants.
Tomato_Tomato_YellowLeaf_Curl_Virus.treatment: Control whiteflies using neem oil or insecticidal soap; use resistant cultivars.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, dark brown spots with yellow halos on leaves and fruit.
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.treatment: Use certified seed, avoid handling wet plants, apply copper-based sprays.

Tomato_Early_blight.symptoms: Dark concentric rings on older leaves, often starting at lower canopy.
Tomato_Early_blight.treatment: Spray mancozeb or chlorothalonil, remove old crop debris.

Tomato_healthy.symptoms: Bright green, uniform leaves without disease symptoms.
Tomato_healthy.treatment: Maintain healthy soil, proper irrigation, and regular monitoring.

Tomato_Late_blight.symptoms: Dark brown, water-soaked lesions on leaves and stems; white mold growth on underside.
Tomato_Late_blight.treatment: Apply copper fungicides, remove infected foliage, avoid overhead watering.

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surface with olive-green mold on underside.
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.treatment: Improve air circulation; use fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb.

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Numerous small circular spots with dark borders and gray centers on leaves.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Remove infected leaves, apply copper fungicides, and avoid water splashing.

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.symptoms: Yellow speckling on leaves, fine webbing, and leaf bronzing.
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.treatment: Spray miticides or neem oil; keep humidity high to reduce mite populations.
